metadata.title: CVE-2014-9037 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: WordPress before 3.7.5, 3.8.x before 3.8.5, 3.9.x before 3.9.3, and 4.xbefore 4.0.1 might allow remote attackers to obtain access to an accountidle since 2008 by leveraging an improper PHP dynamic type comparison foran MD5 hash.

criterions.comment: wordpress: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
